com.textmagic.sms
Class TextMagicMessageService

java.lang.Object
  com.textmagic.sms.TextMagicMessageService
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageService
public class TextMagicMessageService
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageService

Java facade for TextMagic SMS Gateway service. The class provide convenient set of methods to access TextMagic http api.

The class use HttpServiceInvoker implementation for calling http service and TextMagicResponseParser implementation for parsing http api responses

Author:
Rafael Bagmanov

send

public SentMessage send(java.lang.String text,
                        java.lang.String phone)
                 throws ServiceBackendException,
                        ServiceTechnicalException
Convenient shortcut for send(String text, List phones, Integer maxLength, boolean useUnicode) method maxLength is set to 3.
Value of useUnicode flag will be set based on whether text contains Unicode (non GSM 03.38) characters

Specified by:
send in interface MessageService
Parameters:
text - message body to be sent. max length in case of plain message - 480, in case of Unicode message - 210
phone - the msisdn of the message recipient
Returns:
populated SentMessage DTO
Throws:
ServiceBackendException - if server responds with error code
ServiceTechnicalException - if server is inaccessible or response is unexpected
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if phone format is invalid, or text length is too long

public java.util.List<SentMessage> send(java.lang.String text,

Value of useUnicode flag will be set based on whether text contains Unicode (non GSM 03.38) characters

Specified by:

text - message body to be sent. max length in case of plain message - 480, in case of Unicode message - 210
phones - list of msisdn of the message recipients
Returns:
list of populated SentMessage DTOs
Throws:
ServiceBackendException - if server responds with error code
ServiceTechnicalException - if server is inaccessible or response is unexpected
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of phones format is invalid, or text length is too long

send

public java.util.List<SentMessage> send(java.lang.String text,
                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> phones,
                                        boolean useUnicode,
                                        java.lang.Integer maxLength)
                                 throws ServiceBackendException,
                                        ServiceTechnicalException
Sends sms messages with text body to phones specified.

The text can be in 2 formats :
  • plain text - if all text characters belongs to GSM 03.38 character set
  • Unicode text - can include Arabic, Japanese, Russian, Chinese and other world languages characters


One sms message can contain 160 symbols in case of plain text, and 70 in case of unicode.
If the text length is not fit, the text can be divided into parts.
The maxLength parameter provides the ability to set the maximum amount of parts the message can be divided into. Current standard do not supports more than 3 parts.

Specified by:
send in interface MessageService
Parameters:
text - the message to be sent
phones - the list of msisdn the message should be sent to
useUnicode - specifies whether message contains non-GSM characters (true) or not (false)
maxLength - maximum number of parts the text can be divided. accepts 1-3 integer values included
Returns:
list of populated SentMessage DTOs
Throws:
ServiceBackendException - if server responds with error code
ServiceTechnicalException - if server is inaccessible or response is unexpected
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of phones format is invalid, text length is too long, text contains non-GSM characters but useUnicode = false, maxLength in out of bounds

scheduleMessageSending

public java.util.List<SentMessage> scheduleMessageSending(java.lang.String text,
                                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> phones,
                                                          java.util.Date sendingTime,
                                                          java.lang.Integer maxLength)
                                                   throws ServiceTechnicalException,
                                                          ServiceBackendException
Schedule sms message sending with text body to phones specified at exact time.

Specified by:
scheduleMessageSending in interface MessageService
Parameters:
text - the message to be sent
phones - the list of msisdn the message should be sent to
sendingTime - exact time when the message should be sent to provided phones. Must point to the future
maxLength - maximum number of parts the text can be divided. accepts 1-3 integer values included
Returns:
list of populated SentMessage DTOs
Throws:
ServiceBackendException - if server responds with error code
ServiceTechnicalException - if server is inaccessible or response is unexpected
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of phones format is invalid, text length is too long, maxLength in out of bounds, sendingTime is in the past

validatePhonesFormat

protected void validatePhonesFormat(java.util.List<java.lang.String> phones)
Checks whether all phones in provided list have correct msisdn format
The current check is based only on: msisdn is 8-20 digits value
The method can be overridden if more precise check is needed

Parameters:
phones - phone numbers to be validated
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if founds invalid phone number

invoke

protected java.lang.String invoke(java.lang.String command,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params)
                           throws ResponseParsingException,
                                  ServiceBackendException,
                                  ServiceTechnicalException
Does main http api calling cycle: calls http service and check whether the response contains error code

Parameters:
command - http api command to be called
params - the parameters for http api command
Returns:
backend response
Throws:
ResponseParsingException - if parser could not determine whether response contains error code
ServiceBackendException - if http service return error code
ServiceTechnicalException - if http service call failed
